intro: Pincenectia glauca, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small blue or purple clouds. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Pincenectia glauca is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and subtle floral display.
